con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch7="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:sch6="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:sch5="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns:sch2="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:sch1="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch0="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:standingorder="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The StandingOrder services can return ErrorCodes defined in the StandingOrder domain, which is described in this document. However since StandingOrder uses PaymentInitiation for validation of payment data, ErrorCodes from this domain can also be returned. These ErrorCodes are defined in the html documentation for the PIN Services PINSPayment_V1_5.html. The most common are listed below: Common error codes: 0 - OK 12 - Not found 13 - Duplicate entry (e.g. standingOrder already exists) 69 - User not authorized 70 - technical error 6000 - Validation error 6485 - Not authorized for accounts</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:standingorder:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderStatusUpdateRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set status of the SO given by the SO key to the status given Error Codes (Standing Order Error codes starts from 7000 series): 7020 - Invalid agreement key. 7023 - Invalid agreement key, the id part is invalid. 7024 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is invalid. 7025 - Invalid status change type. 7026 - Invalid state change. 7027 - Invalid Days before due date. 7035 - Agreement is already approved by the user. 7050 - Unable to find any Standing Order Agreement that matches the search criteria. 7051 - Search result too large, unable to choose a unique agreement with the given search criteria. 7105 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is Not Found. 7117 - Standing Order, delete iHub agreement failed. 7118 - Standing Order, create iHub agreement failed. 7119 - Standing order status update failed. 7123 - The debtor agent bic and debtor account bic are not same. 7125 - Agreement is already verified by the user.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrderKey" type="standingorder:standingOrderKey"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderAction" type="standingorder:standingOrderActionEnum"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderStatusUpdateResponse"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="standingOrderStatus" type="standingorder:standingOrderStatusEnum"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderVerifySearchRequest"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrderVerifySearch" type="tns:standingOrderVerifySearch"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderVerifySearch"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Search criteria for searching the Pending Verification Standing Order Agreements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="verifySearchCriteria" type="standingorder:verifySearchCriteria"/> <xs:element name="pagingElement" type="cm:pagingInputElementType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderVerifySearchResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Response from searching standingOrders for Verify. If none found an empty list is returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="standingOrders" type="standingorder:standingOrderVerifySearchType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="elementControl" type="cm:ElementControlOut"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderSearchRequest"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrderSearch" type="tns:standingOrderSearch"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderSearch"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Search criteria for searching the Standing Order Agreements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="searchCriteria" type="standingorder:searchCriteria"/> <xs:element name="pagingElement" type="cm:pagingInputElementType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderSearchResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Response from searching standingOrders. If none found an empty list is returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="standingOrders" type="standingorder:standingOrderSearchType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="elementControl" type="cm:ElementControlOut"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderCreateRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Create a new distinct standingOrder. Error Codes (Standing Order Error codes starts from 7000 series) : 6440 - Creditor agent country code missing. 7002 - Agreement end date cannot be a past date or current date. 7004 - Agreement end date should be after first due date. 7005 - End date should be after second due date. 7009 - Exemption end date should be same or after exemption start date. 7010 - Exemption range should be within the agreement range. 7011 - Cannot have duplicate exemptions. 7012 - Given Recurrence not defined in PBD. 7013 - Agreement should have first due date. 7014 - Semi-Monthly recurrence should have second due date. 7015 - Second due date should be last day or second last day of the month. 7016 - First due date should be last day or second last day of the previous month of Second due date. 7017 - One of the First or Second due date should be 15th of a month. 7022 - Unknown Trigger Type. 7028 - No interval will be created because the agreement is not active during proposed interval. 7029 - Invalid Standing Order Agreement Status. 7034 - Second Due Date is applicable only for Recurrence SEMI-MONTHLY. 7043 - The percent value is below zero. 7055 - Credit account not set for split. 7056 - Credit account for split does not exist in transaction list. 7057 - The number of splits is invalid for corresponding trigger type. 7062 - One of amount or percent must be set for a split. 7063 - Percentage is not applicable for the limit type BELOW. 7064 - Given Purpose Code does not exist in PBD. 7065 - The calculated amount to transfer is less than the minimum amount allowed. 7066 - Invalid denominator. 7069 - Recurrence not found. 7070 - Exemption start or end date not found. 7073 - Splits not found. 7074 - Balance trigger fields not found. 7075 - Balance trigger limit type not found. 7078 - Balance trigger limit amount not found. 7079 - Purpose not found. 7080 - Incoming transaction can't cover all external splits. 7081 - External trigger service accessed with illegal amount of transactions. 7082 - The percentage given for splits is over hundred. 7085 - The given trigger type is not available for current user. 7087 - Exemption with yearly recurrence has a period that is longer or equal to a year. 7089 - Invalid Amount, Amount cannot be zero. 7090 - Invalid Amount, Amount should be based on ISO Code – 18,5. 7093 - Currency Code not found. 7094 - Agreement exists with same PURPOSE and DEBIT account. 7095 - The debtor account is not in producing bank. 7096 - The creditor account is not in producing bank. 7097 - The number of splits for balance agreement should be one. 7099 - A external trigger transaction must be domestic. 7100 - Debtor agent country is not found. 7101 - Balance trigger is not applicable. 7102 - Splits are not required for Periodic agreements. 7103 - User Segment Type Not found. 7104 - Second due date is equal to end date and is a bank holiday, Please adjust the agreement end date. 7105 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is Not Found. 7106 - Purpose/Text Code/Category Purpose should not be null. 7107 - Purpose is not applicable. 7108 - Transaction amount cannot be null for Periodic agreements. 7109 - Recurrence is not applicable for External agreements. 7110 - Bank Holiday Adjustment is not applicable for External agreements. 7111 - Agreement with Recurrence Semi Monthly, cannot have more than two Due Dates. 7112 - Agreement exists with same limit type and account. 7113 - Transaction cannot have PaymentTypeCode. 7114 - Agreement cannot be created with same credit and debit account numbers. 7115 - Balance Agreements cannot have more than one transactions. 7116 - Debtor account is missing 7120 - The debtor agent bic is mandatory for foreign account 7121 - Standing Order has Domestic payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7122 - Standing Order has International payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7123 - The debtor agent bic and debtor account bic are not same. 7126 - Balance Above cannot have Split Amount greater than Limit Amount. 7127 - Balance Below cannot have Split Amount lesser than Limit Amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrder" type="standingorder:standingOrderCreateType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderCreateResponse"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="standingOrderKey" type="standingorder:standingOrderKey"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The standingOrderKey to the newly created standingOrder - given that the service was able to succeed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="futureTransactions" type="standingorder:transaction"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderUpdateRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Update a new standingOrder. This will cause the creation of a new SO with the same agreementReferenceNumber and a new agreementVersionNumber Error Codes (Standing Order Error codes starts from 7000 series) : 7020 - Invalid agreement key. 7023 - Invalid agreement key, the id part is invalid. 7024 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is invalid. 7031 - Standing Order Update not allowed for Status CLOSED, PENDING_CLOSE. 7032 - Standing Order Type, does not match. 7050 - Unable to find any Standing Order Agreement that matches the search criteria. 7051 - Search result too large, unable to choose a unique agreement with the given search criteria. 7098 - Unable to resolve new first due date. 7105 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is Not Found. 7107 - Purpose is not applicable. 7108 - Transaction amount cannot be null for Periodic agreements. 7111 - Agreement with Recurrence Semi Monthly, cannot have more than two Due Dates. 7112 - Agreement exists with same limit type and account. 7113 - Transaction cannot have PaymentTypeCode. 7114 - Agreement cannot be created with same credit and debit account numbers. 7115 - Balance Agreements cannot have more than one transactions. 7116 - Debtor account is missing 7120 - The debtor agent bic is missing 7121 - Standing Order has Domestic payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7122 - Standing Order has International payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7123 - The debtor agent bic and debtor account bic are not same. 7124 - Employee is not authorised to perform requested operation. 7126 - Balance Above cannot have Split Amount greater than Limit Amount. 7127 - Balance Below cannot have Split Amount lesser than Limit Amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrder" type="standingorder:standingOrderUpdateType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:element name="standingOrderCreateRequest" type="tns:standingOrderCreateRequest"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderCreateResponse" type="tns:standingOrderCreateResponse"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderCreateFault" type="cm:responseStateCodedFault"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderStatusUpdateRequest" type="tns:standingOrderStatusUpdateRequest"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderStatusUpdateResponse" type="tns:standingOrderStatusUpdateResponse"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderStatusUpdateFault" type="cm:responseStateCodedFault"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderUpdateRequest" type="tns:standingOrderUpdateRequest"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderUpdateResponse" type="tns:standingOrderCreateResponse"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderUpdateFault" type="cm:responseStateCodedFault"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderSearchRequest" type="tns:standingOrderSearchRequest"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderSearchResponse" type="tns:standingOrderSearchResponse"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderSearchFault" type="cm:responseStateCodedFault"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderVerifySearchRequest" type="tns:standingOrderVerifySearchRequest"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderVerifySearchResponse" type="tns:standingOrderVerifySearchResponse"/> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeInfoTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TOTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TOTA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in the transfer currency deducted from the transfer amount. Pertains only to outgoing payments where charges on the sender side are to be borne by the beneficiary.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 1 = Debited account separately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 2 = Accumulated and debited/invoiced at intervals.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 3 = Fees deducted from transferred amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="HIGH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is high.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NORM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is normal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OriginalFormatCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CLIENT_GENERATED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ISO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an ISO file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a NDR file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELEPAY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Telepay file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMUL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Paymul file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration order was transferred to pass by accompanying note signed by hand</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ExchangeRateTypeCode"> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the market rate at the time of the sale.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EinvoiceType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UUIDv4Type"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[a-f0-9]{8}-[a-f0-9]{4}-4[a-f0-9]{3}-[ab89]{1}[a-f0-9]{3}-[a-f0-9]{12}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceLevelCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="URGP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Urgent payment - ISO code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Norwegian real-time payment - EVRY proprietary code. The transaction will be reserved on both the debitor and creditor and completed immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EINV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice - EVRY proprietary code. This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. If an eInvoice is created with in payment initiation without this service level, it is the responsibility of the calling system to update NETS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INTD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal direct debit - EVRY proprietary code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No real time reservation - EVRY proprietary code. This can be used if the due date is equal to today's date to skip over an immediate reservation, that is, to create reservations when the ReservationEngine normally runs</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DRDB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Direct debit - EVRY proprietary code (for example, AvtaleGiro)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GLMS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use from GLM. It will force the payment being processed as "real foreign account", and sent as MT101 (or whatever PBD's foreign agreement says)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOCR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use in domestic and foreign domestic, normal priority payments without an advice out.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ZRCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will activate skipping charges during payment processing. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DVCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will mark the payment as having a deviating charge. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AutoConfirm"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DISABLED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Default if not given. Clients will require calling payment status update confirm web service to activate the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_BUT_DISABLED_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If any warnings are encountered during validation, then autoConfirm will be disabled. The client can then show the warnings to the user and the user can manually confirm that they accept the warnings, i.e. duplicate payment detected</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_FORCE_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confirm will be executed even if there are warnings.Validation errors will of course disable confirm as the payment is invalid.Warnings will still be shown in the response but if the user wishes to not to perform the payment, then payment must be cancelled if possible (note that real-time payments will have already been performed and cannot be cancelled).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". May be used if application supports localized response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ip" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ip adress of the client</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="item" nillable="true" type="itemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optionnal extention items - Add key/value pairs for application specific extentions</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="itemType"> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EDBHeaderType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SourceApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the source that initiated the message. Default is english language. base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max30Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max35Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="35"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max36Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="36"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max40Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="40"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max50Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="50"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max70Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="70"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max140Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="140"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max170Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="170"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max200Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="200"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max105Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="105"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max254Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="254"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="trueFalseAndAnyStatus"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TRUE"/> <xs:enumeration value="FALSE"/> <xs:enumeration value="ANY"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="2"/> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SortingDirection"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ASCENDING"/> <xs:enumeration value="DESCENDING"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MarketType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MarketTypeCriteria"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ALL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ALL</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="cm:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="cm:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="cm:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. See also initiatorIdentifier that is the id of the party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eInvoiceType" type="st:EinvoiceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of eInvoice, based on from where it comes from.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to identify the documents referred to in the remittance information." Typical use: invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:ReferredDocumentType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of referred document." Values: CINV, CREN Default: CINV</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous identification of the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="relatedDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date associated with the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="invoiceeOtherId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the party to whom an invoice is issued, when it is different from the debtor or ultimate debtor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationStructured" type="tns:RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="tns:ReferredDocumentInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentAmount" type="tns:ReferredDocumentAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="duePayableAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified is the exact amount due and payable to the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditNoteAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditorReferenceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:CreditorReferenceInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type of creditor reference, in a coded form Values: DISP, FXDR, PUOR, RADM, RPIN, SCOR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Entity that assigns the credit reference type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="reference" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeType" type="st:ChequeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of cheque to be issued." Values: BCHQ</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliveryMethod" type="st:DeliveryMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the delivery method of the cheque by the debtor's agent." Values: MLCD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeFrom" type="tns:chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies the party that ordered the issuance of the cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliverTo" type="tns:chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to whom the debtor's agent needs to send the cheque"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="chequeIdentificationType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Name by which a party is known and is usually used to identify that identity."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Postal address of a party"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="listTransactionResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Placeholder for possible error codes for each transaction within a PaymentListCreate</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instructionIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction id, as given by the client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction id, as generated by underlying DB.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="releaseDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the earliest possible date for when the this payment will be due date processed. Bank holiday (in debtor bank) and time of day (after last due date process) can affect the release date. Rejected payments do not have a release date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="errorItem" type="tns:errorItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of error codes. If list is missing, transaction has been created successfully.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="warningItem" type="tns:warningItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of warning codes. If list is missing, transaction has been created with no warnings.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="errorItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Key/value pair holding error Code and error message</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="errorCode" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="errorMessage" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="warningItemType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Key/value pair holding warning code and warning message</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="warningCode" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="warningMessage" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AgreementDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possibility to search for payments with certain agreements</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="agreementType" type="st:AgreementType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement type, e.g Standing Order, Avtalegiro and Loan</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementId" type="tns:AgreementId"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AgreementId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement id and version</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="id" type="st:Max18Long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique id of the agreement.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="version" type="st:Max18Long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Some agreements can have an additional version field. Can be used here to narrow down to a specific version of the agreement</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AdditionalServiceCharge"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges for additional services</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceName" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the additional service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="charge" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The charge associated with the additional service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ApproverType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="userid" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"/> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODateTime"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="GroupHeader"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of characteristics shared by all individual transactions included in the message.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creationDateTime" type="cm:ISODateTime"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>CreationDateTime is set by PAYS in all request operations. Can therefore be omitted in all requests. name="reference" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="interbankSettlementDate" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitAmountCounterValue" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditAmountCounterValue" type="tns:SettlementAmount"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="chargeInfo" type="tns:SettlementChargeInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SettlementAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeInfo" type="tns:CurrencyExchangeInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CurrencyExchangeInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="sourceCurrency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="targetCurrency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="unitCurrency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="quotationDate" type="cm:ISODateTime"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SettlementChargeInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="chargedAmount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="type" type="st:ChargeInfoTypeCode"/> <xs:element name="bearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DateCriteria"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="accurateDate" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="dateFromTo" type="tns:DateFromTo"/> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DateFromTo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="fromDate" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="toDate" type="cm:ISODate"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountCriteria"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Accurate, max or min amount, aggregate accurate, or aggregate max or min amount. Amount will match against both InstructedAmount and Equivalent Amount. Note that for equivalentAmount the currencyCode will NOT be mapped against currencyOfTransfer. The non-aggregated filters will match single payments, while the aggregated filters will match the aggregated sums of payments per grouping (grouping depends on which search is being performed, i.e. mesage level, payment info level, etc.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="accurateAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="amountMaxMin" type="tns:AmountMaxMin"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="aggregatedAccurateAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="aggregatedAmountMaxMin" type="tns:AmountMaxMin"/> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currencyCode" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountMaxMin"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="minAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="maxAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SumAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmount" type="tns:AggregatedAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for payments</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="accumulatedAmounts" type="tns:AccumulatedAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of accumulated instructed amounts for each Amount Currency Code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AggregatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmountBaseCurrency" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for payments calculated in base currency</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for all selected payments independently of currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AccumulatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="accumulatedAmount" type="tns:Amount"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="StatusReason"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:StatusReasonCode"/> <xs:element name="message" type="cm:Max170Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional message explaining the reason. Might come from the external system without any modifications</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sourceSystem" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="additionalInfo" type="cm:Max105Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: Generic type for all information specific to the nation for the request (for example AvtaleGiro/eInvoice capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway). This type is used in the WS response objects (i.e. agreement proposal response).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAdditionalInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment additional information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitValueDate" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Debit value date rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditValueDate" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Credit value date rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChargeOption"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Either, indication of whether payment's original charge should be preserved or not, or specification of an explicit charge that should be applied.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="preserveOriginalChargeParameters" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates whether the payment's original initiatorId and channel should be preserved when charge is retrieved. Setting this to false means that charge will be retrieved based on the current userId and PaymentChannel.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="charge" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The charge to be applied to the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EditPaymentOptions"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeOption" type="tns:ChargeOption"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of characteristics that applies to the debit side of the payment transactions included in the credit transfer initiation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentTypeInformation" type="tns:PaymentTypeInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtorAgentBIC" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BIC of debtor agent. Only needs to be provided if debtor agent is other than initiator agent, e.g. for foreign account purposes. If left out, PI will set debtorAgent=initiatorAgent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateDebtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Ultimate party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionForDebtorAgent" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, that may need to be acted upon by the debtor agent, depending on agreement between debtor and the debtor agent. Usage: when present, then the instructions for the debtor agent apply for all credit transfer transaction information occurrences, present in the payment information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentTypeInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of elements used to further specify the type of transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element default="NORM" minOccurs="0" name="instructionPriority" type="st:PriorityCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Urgency or order of importance that the originator would like the recipient of the payment instruction to apply to the processing of the payment instruction."
Values: HIGH, NORM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceLevel" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agreement under which or rules under which the transaction should be processed"
Values: URGENT_PAYMENT - URGP, NORWEGIAN_REAL_TIME_PAYMENT - NRTP, STANDING_ORDER - STO AVTALE_GIRO - AGR INTERNAL_DIRECT_DEBIT - INTD, EINVOICE - EINV, NO_REAL_TIME_RESERVATION - NRTR, GLMS - GLMS, CHARGE - CHRG, CHARGE_ENGINE_INHOUSE - INCE CHARGE_ENGINE_CEPO - CEPO, NO_ADVICE - NOCR, ZERO_CHARGE - ZRCH, DEVIATING_CHARGE - DVCH, CORRECTION - FREE and free text upto 35 characters.
Default: (none)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="localInstrument" type="cm:LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "User community specific instrument. Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level."
Values: TO BE DECIDED! (not an enum yet..)
Default:</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="categoryPurpose" type="st:CategoryPurposeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories. Usage: This is used by the initiating party to provide information concerning the processing of the payment. It is likely to trigger special processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain."
For banks using DNB Payment engine for international payments: PI will set this value based on instructionPriority.
Values: INVS, SALA, IDCP, CASH, CORT, INTC, PENS, SSBE, SUPP, TAXS, TREA, VATX, LOAN, OTHR
Default: SUPP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party." Must be unset for StandingOrders where amount is calculated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeRateInformation" type="ct:ExchangeRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeBearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction." Values: SHAR, DEBT, CRED, SLEV Default set by PAYS if missing in request: SHAR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent1" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #1 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent2" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #2 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent3" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #3 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAgent" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateCreditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Ultimate party to which an amount of money is due.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="instructionForCreditorAgent" type="ct:InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="regulatoryReporting" type="ct:RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorScorReference" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to reference OCR/KID
The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="internalNote" type="cm:Max40Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal note, not part of the ISO standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Payments created/updated with this flag will only show in Search if user has Confidential role.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="ct:ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="internalProductCode" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISPC details.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="marketProductName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Market product name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema namespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="verifySearchCriteria"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The search criteria elements for searching the Standing Order.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="customerNumber" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates the customer Number</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="originatorId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> type="standingorder:standingOrderKey"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The key indicates the Id and Version of the Agreement</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element
