<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch8="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v2_0" xmlns:sch7="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:sch6="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns:sch2="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:sch1="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v2_0"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:pay="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:nor="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Services for Creating, Updating and Reading payments.
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 0=OK [validation warnings can appear in errorItems] 10=Bad or missing input 12=No data found 13=Duplicate entry 26=Unknown bank 59=Insufficient funds 70=Technical error 373=Logical duplicate 383=Payment failed due to technical error 464=Receiving account is not valid for real-time payments 466=Invalid security (MAC,crypto,sign) 467=Unexpected transaction change 469=CID is not allowed for real-time payments 6000=Validation error [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items, shown below] 6438=Unknown transaction id (Update/Read) 6439=Not a unique payment. Duplicate keys found. 6484=No agreement can be found for this user. 6485=Not authorized for accounts 6489=Not authorized for transaction id 6602=Payment status is not valid for update 6603=Not authorized for operation 6700=Validation error where all transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6701=Validation error where some transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6614=Customer information not found 6496=Processing line not found 6500=PE processing line not found 6857=Invalid Creditor Account number or User is not authorized for Creditor Account
Validation errors (can be found in responseState.errorItem): 59=Insufficient funds 69=User not authorized for service 419=Invalid due date 465=The requested amount exceeds the allowable limit for real-time payments 6401=Invalid creditor agent identification (Creditor agent) 6402=Invalid creditor account number (Creditor account) 6403=Invalid creditor account number length (Creditor account) 6405=Creditor agent country not open for trade (Creditor agent) 6406=Invalid creditor country code (Creditor) 6407=Blocking found for payment (Warnings and blockings rules) 6408=Counter values can not be calculated due to missing foreign exchange rates for transfer currency (Foreign exchange rate) 6409=Creditor country is missing (Creditor) 6411=Requested execution date passes max forwarding days (Execution date) 6412=Invalid regulatory reporting code (Regulatory reporting) 6413=Regulatory reporting info required (Regulatory reporting) 6414=Transaction amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6415=Periodic amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6416=Regulatory reporting amount limit reached and no regulatory reporting codes provided (Regulatory reporting) 6417=Invalid creditor agent BIC identification 6429=Creditor name missing (Creditor)
6440=Creditor agent country code missing (Creditor agent) 6441=Invalid debtor agent identification (Debtor) 6445=Invalid format of OCR (Creditor reference) 6446=OCR number is mandatory for the given creditor account.(Creditor account) 6447=Debtor account must be tax account (Debtor account) 6450=User has no access to payment (Domestic payment) 6452=Creditor town name missing (Cheque payment) 6453=Creditor post code missing (Cheque payment) 6454=Creditor account missing (Cheque payment) 6455=No OCR is provided (Norwegian OCR payment) 6458=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6459=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6460=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6462=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6463=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6464=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6466=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6467=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 1 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6468=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 2 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6469=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 3 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6473=Creditor agent identification missing (Creditor agent) 6475=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 1 country (Currency) 6476=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 2 country (Currency) 6477=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 3 country (Currency) 6481=Identification for intermediary agent 1 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6482=Identification for intermediary agent 2 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6483=Identification for intermediary agent 3 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6486=Invalid country for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6487=Invalid country for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6488=Invalid country for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6490=Transfer currency is not valid. (Currency) 6491=Invalid creditor agent country (Creditor agent) 6494=Tax account is not supported for country (Debtor account) 6497=Register amount limit exceeded (Regulatory reporting) 6498=No OCR agreement found 6503=User not authorized for account 6504=Account is invalid, or user is not authorized to use it 6507=Customer Agreement not found 6512=Bank details not found for IBAN 6513=Creditor agent BIC is required 6515=Creditor agent national id is required 6516=Creditor agent national id is mandatory when creditor account is BBAN 6518=Payment information identification must be unique 6520=Instruction identification must be unique 6521=Invalid mid-rate 6522=Invalid sell rate 6523=Invalid agreed rate 6525=Market Product could not be determined 6526=Transaction Fee could not be determined 6534=Transfer currency decimal count exceeded 6532=Unable to determine Payment Type 6533=Unable to determine ISPC 6535=Found no match for the supplied BIC 6536=Found no match for the supplied OrgId 6537=The given cheque type code is invalid 6538=The given delivery method code is invalid 6540=Payment amount is equal or below zero 6541=Creditor account should not be present 6542=The given payment method is not a valid payment method 6543=Invalid category purpose 6544=Category purpose code salary cannot be mixed with other codes 6545=CID or message to receiver is present at the same time as structured information 6546=Creditor agent is missing 6547=Cheque instruction not found 6551=Unknown error from Topup Server (prepaid) 6561=Only unstructured remittance information is allowed for cheque payments 6562=Not able to retrieve service information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6563=Not able to retrieve customer information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6564=Payment was rejected in recharge system (Prepaid card) 6565=Transaction ok within invalid message (Payment list) 6566=Creditor identification is required (Prepaid card) 6567=Missing Exchange rate 6568=Creditor and Debtor account should not be the same 6569=Service id is required ListCreate (Prepaid card) 6610=Can´t have more than one ISPC for a payment instruction (IPC) 6611=Can not determine ISPC (IPC) 6623=Invalid creditor post code 6637=Invalid amount, the amount is matched with debtor account 6638=Invalid amount, the amount is matched with creditor account 6805=Sum of all remitted amount must be equal to transaction's amount 6807=Payment is not qualified for real time payments 6808=The creditor account must be a valid Norwegian account to qualify for real-time payments 6809=Can not create payments from local deposit accounts 6810=Can not create payments from guarantee accounts 6811=Can not create payments from loan accounts 6812=Can not create payments from currency deposit accounts 6814=Valid values for ReferredDocumentInformationTypeCode is CINV and CREN. 6815=Valid ReferredDocumentInformationTypeCode for CreditNoteAmount is CREN. 6816=More than one remittance structured must be present for CreditNoteAmount 6817=Either OCR number or Invoice number must be present in Structured Remittance Information. 6818=OCR number and TypeCode must be present for CreditorReferenceInformation. 6819=Invoice Number is missing from ReferredDocumentInformation. 6820=ReferredDocumentAmount is missing from structured information. 6821=CREN is not valid ReferredDocumentInformationTypeCode when DuePayableAmount or RemittedAmount present 6822=Single structured remittance must be present for AdditionalRemittanceInformation 6823=Interim Account not found 6824=Evry transaction code not found 6825=Either debit or credit evry transaction code is not found 6826=Text code not found 6830=Credit amount must be in instructed amount for in-house payments 6832=Supplementary data Debit amount is not found for charge engine in-house payment 6835=The requestedExecutionDate is either in the past, on a weekend day or too far into the future. 6836=The Req Credit Value Date can't be honored because the req execution date has already passed. 6837=The payment can't be executed in time to honor the Req Credit Value Date. Today's cutoff time has passed 6839=The parameter Requested Credit Value Date cannot be used in conjunction with a foreign debtor agent 6840=The parameter Requested Credit Value Date cannot be used with norwegian real-time payments 6841=The parameter Requested Credit Value Date cannot be used in Private Market payments 6842=Debtor's postal address is missing 6843=Contractid is required for AGRD and SALE ratetype 6844=SPOT can't be combined with rate and contractid 6845=Exchange rate cannot provide if equivalent amount is not in debit account currency 6852=Internal transfers require the debtor and creditor accounts to be within the same bank 6853=Charge bearer is not allowed 6854=Creditor Address type should not contain both Email Address and Fax Number 6856=Transaction amount should not be less than or equal to Product charges 6858=Invoice reference is required for service level EINVOICE 6859=EInvoice not allowed for salary payment 6860=EInvoice not allowed for international payment 6862=The req credit value date is not a bank business day for the credit currency country (transfer currency) 6866=PaymentEngine name not defined in PBD 6872=Creditor Address is missing. Either structured or unstructured creditor address is mandatory 6873=Creditor details is required for given creditor agent country 6874=Requested execution date exceeds max days allowed for advance credit 6875=Only transfers in NOK can be used for payments having advanced credit reservations 6833=Payment without creditor account number
Validations warnings (can be found in responseState.errorItem)[payment is stored, user can either ignore warning or do an Update operation to act on those warnings.]: 6404=Requested execution date has passed. Release date has been moved to the next valid bank date. 6410=Cutoff time has passed. Payment might not be released in time for requested execution date (Execution date) 6427=Warning found for payment (Warning and blocking rules) 6456=A similar payment was recently added. Make sure it is not a mistake. (Logical duplicate check) 6470=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in debtor agent country (Execution date) 6471=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in initiator agent country (Execution date) 6472=Payment may not be released in time for requested execution date and will be released on the next valid bank day (Execution date) 6424=Transaction is close to SEPA, but transfer currency is not EUR (SEPA) 6425=Transaction is close to SEPA, but instruction priority is not NORM (SEPA) 6492=Transaction is close to SEPA, but charge bearer is not SHAR (SEPA) 6493=Transaction is close to SEPA, but creditor account number is not an IBAN (SEPA) 6499=Creditor agent BIC and NationalID do not belong to same Bank hence BIC added as Intermediary Agent 6571=Agreement capture type combination is invalid for einvoice payment 6572=Agreement capture is not allowed for payment update 6573=Agreed Exchange rate deviation is larger than allowed. 6855=Transfer currency changed to creditor account currency 6876=Receipt stickers can not be ordered for this type of payment
6846=Instruction Debtor Agent Code is invalid 6848=Instruction Creditor Agent Code is invalid 6849=Duplicate Instruction Creditor Agent Code has been ignored 6850=Debtor or Creditor Agent Instructions are not allowed for domestic payment</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v2_0"/> <xs:import <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="URGP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Urgent payment - ISO code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Norwegian real-time payment - EVRY proprietary code. The transaction will be reserved on both the debitor and creditor and completed immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EINV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice - EVRY proprietary code. This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. If an eInvoice is created with in payment initiation without this service level, it is the responsibility of the calling system to update NETS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INTD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal direct debit - EVRY proprietary code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No real time reservation - EVRY proprietary code. This can be used if the due date is equal to today's date to skip over an immediate reservation, that is, to create reservations when the ReservationEngine normally runs</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DRDB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Direct debit - EVRY proprietary code (for example, AvtaleGiro)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GLMS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use from GLM. It will force the payment being processed as "real foreign account", and sent as MT101 (or whatever PBD's foreign agreement says)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOCR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use in domestic and foreign domestic, normal priority payments without an advice out.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ZRCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will activate skipping charges during payment processing. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DVCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will mark the payment as having a deviating charge. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AutoConfirm"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DISABLED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Default if not given. Clients will require calling payment status update confirm web service to activate the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_BUT_DISABLED_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If any warnings are encountered during validation, then autoConfirm will be disabled. The client can then show the warnings to the user and the user can manually confirm that they accept the warnings, i.e. duplicate payment detected</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_FORCE_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confirm will be executed even if there are warnings.Validation errors will of course disable confirm as the payment is invalid.Warnings will still be shown in the response but if the user wishes to not to perform the payment, then payment must be cancelled if possible (note that real-time payments will have already been performed and cannot be cancelled).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="cm:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="cm:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. DNB payment engine only accepts TRF.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentTypeInformation" type="tns:PaymentTypeInformation"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="requestedExecutionDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="requestedCreditValueDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The requested credit value date for the payment. For banks using DNB Payment engine for international payments: PI will set this value based on instructionPriority.

Default: SUPP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeRateInformation" type="ct:ExchangeRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeBearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction." The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation" type="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: All information specific to the nation for the payment request can be sent here. Use this field to control the proposal fetch. If not defined, no agreement capture will be performed. AVTALEGIRO to fetch potential AvtaleGiro proposals, COMBINATION for fetching proposal which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvocing reference). Should only be used for payments with CID defined. If this value is given, a possible agreement capture proposal will be returned in the response for the given AgreementCaptureType. This should only be used for payments with CID defined (see creditorScorReference).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianNationalPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementProposalCapture" type="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Object containing information relevant to agreement capture. I.e. if the payer is registering a bill to a beneficiary offering AvtaleGiro, the payer could be offered an AvtaleGiro proposal immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="EProviderProposal" type="tns:EProviderProposal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information about name and status of eInvoice providers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="AVTALEGIRO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request to fetch potential AvtaleGiro agreement proposals</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="COMBINATION"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request for fetching proposals which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvoicing reference)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v2_0" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v2_0" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v2_0" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns:sch2="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:sch1="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v2_0"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:pin="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Operations for updating status of payments. All operations can be performed on message, account, paymentInformation and transcation level. Short explanation of the statuses (see supplementary documentation for further details) Confirm: validated -> toBeApproved | validated -> readyForDueDate (if approval is not used) Approve: toBeApproved -> readyForDueDate | toBeApproved -> toBeApproved (if more than 1 approval needed) Unapprove: readyForDueDate -> toBeApproved Cancel: * -> cancelled Prioritize: readyForDueDate -> readyForDueDate w/priority mark Unprioritize: readyForDueDate w/priority mark -> readyForDueDate Stop: readyForDueDate -> stopped Reactivate: stopped -> readyForDueDate Verify: toBeVerified -> readyForDueDate | toBeVerified -> toBeVerified (if additional verifiers needed) IgnoreLimit: stopped (due to payment over agreement limit) -> readyForDueDate Force funds: release a payment and skip funds check . Bank user must have access to override coverage control when registering payment instructions or free posting. Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 70=Technical error (Uncategorized) 6426=No payments found for status update (Validation) 6485=Not authorized for accounts (Validation) 6549=Required account identification (Account as input) 6600=Status update failed for all matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
Validation conditions (responseState.ErrorCode) 6601=Status update failed for some matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
In case of 6600/6601, see errorCode, errrorMessage and severity for each payment. This corresponds to items normally found in the standard ResponseStateType, but since there is the possible for multiple payments for each status update operation, each error is specific to each payment transaction. 6602=Payment status is not valid for update 6620=PaymentConfirm failed since one of the original transactions has been altered. 6622=Same status update request is already registred and inprogress 6552=Agreement is already approved by the user. 6593=Payment status update failed due to no access 6603=User not authorized to perform requested operation 6622=Same status update request is already registred and inprogress 6806=Payment is already verified by the user
Validations warnings (can be found in responseState.errorItem) 6621=Status Update request received and will be processed soon
If no payments matches the requested criteria, an error will be thrown. If at least one payment fulfills the requested criteria, a validation error will be added for each failing payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import payment(s)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentApproveResponse" type="tns:PaymentApproveResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Response from Approve name="PaymentStatusResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If there are more than 500 records updated, only paymentStatusUpdateSummary will be included in the response and no paymentStatusUpdateResult will be returned. If less than 500 records, both paymentStatusUpdateSummary and paymentStatusUpdateResult elements will be returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="paymentStatusUpdateSummary" type="pin:PaymentStatusUpdateSummaryItem"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="500" minOccurs="0" name="paymentStatusUpdateResult" type="pin:PaymentStatusUpdateResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. If an eInvoice is created with in payment initiation without this service level, it is the responsibility of the calling system to update NETS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INTD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal direct debit - EVRY proprietary code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No real time reservation - EVRY proprietary code. This can be used if the due date is equal to today's date to skip over an immediate reservation, that is, to create reservations when the ReservationEngine normally runs</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DRDB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Direct debit - EVRY proprietary code (for example, AvtaleGiro)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GLMS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use from GLM. It will force the payment being processed as "real foreign account", and sent as MT101 (or whatever PBD's foreign agreement says)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOCR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use in domestic and foreign domestic, normal priority payments without an advice out.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ZRCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will activate skipping charges during payment processing. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DVCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will mark the payment as having a deviating charge. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AutoConfirm"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DISABLED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Default if not given. Clients will require calling payment status update confirm web service to activate the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_BUT_DISABLED_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If any warnings are encountered during validation, then autoConfirm will be disabled. The client can then show the warnings to the user and the user can manually confirm that they accept the warnings, i.e. duplicate payment detected</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_FORCE_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confirm will be executed even if there are warnings.Validation errors will of course disable confirm as the payment is invalid.Warnings will still be shown in the response but if the user wishes to not to perform the payment, then payment must be cancelled if possible (note that real-time payments will have already been performed and cannot be cancelled).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". May be used if application supports localized response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ip" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ip adress of the client</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="item" nillable="true" type="itemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optionnal extention items - Add key/value pairs for application specific extentions</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="itemType"> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EDBHeaderType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SourceApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the source that initiated the message. Used to separate different service providers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Function" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the service to be called.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Version" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Service version "X.Y.Z" according to this standard: X = Main release (major changes, not necessarily backwards compatible) Y = Minor release (backwards compatible, new functionality) Z = Bugfix (backwards compatible, error correction only)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ClientContext" type="ClientContextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Elements for identifying client context information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="AutHeader" type="EDBHeaderType"/> <xsd:complexType name="ResponseStateType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ErrorCode" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric error code reported for this error.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Severity" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response Status Severity Code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ComponentId" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique code identifying the component returning the service response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Message" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Message describing the error. Default is english language. Optionally localized according to the locale parameter in the service request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="LogSequence" nillable="true" type="xsd:long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional key generated to be used for log correlation purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="cm:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="cm:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice.
