Authorization agreement in PWH</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentAuthorizationCreateResponse" type="tns:PaymentAuthorizationCreateResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Simple baseResponseType for the PaymentAuthorizationCreate request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAuthorizationCreateRequest"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="cpsAuthorizationMessage" type="aut2:CPSPaymentAuthorizationCreateMessage"/> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAuthorizationCreateResponse"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="edb:baseResponseType"/> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v1" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v1"> <xs:simpleType name="ISODate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ISODateTime"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max15NumericText"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[0-9]{1,15}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DecimalNumber"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="17"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BaseOneRate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="10"/> <xs:totalDigits value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Amount_SimpleType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="5"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Amount_SimpleType_NoFractions"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="0"/> <xs:totalDigits value="12"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="HIGH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is high.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NORM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is normal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{6,6}[A-Z2-9][A-NP-Z0-9]([A-Z0-9]{3,3}){0,1}"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> value="[A-Z]{2,2}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PaymentTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_HIGH_VALUE"> <xs:annotation> name="PhoneNumber"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="\+[0-9]{1,3}-[0-9()+\-]{1,30}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max10Text"> <xs:restriction name="Max70Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="\S.*\S|\S"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="70"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max128Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="128"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max140Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="\S.*\S|\S"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="140"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max170Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="\S.*\S|\S"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="170"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max105Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="\S.*\S|\S"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="105"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max254Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="\S.*\S|\S"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="254"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OriginalFormatCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CLIENT_GENERATED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ISO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an ISO file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a NDR file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELEPAY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Telepay file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMUL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Paymul file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALARY_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a salary file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMENT_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a payment list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PREPAID_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a prepaid list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="UNKNOWN"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unknown origin (migrated?)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v1" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v1" xmlns:st="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v1"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v1"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="st:PhoneNumber"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="country" type="st:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="tns:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="SPOT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the market rate at the time of the sale.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" <wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_4" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_4" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch5="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_4" xmlns:sch4="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v5" xmlns:sch3="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v4" xmlns:sch2="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1" xmlns:sch1="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_4"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentstatusupdate:v1_4" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:pin="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:payment-status-update:v1_4" xmlns:edb="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:edb-types:v1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Operations for updating status of payments. All operations can be performed on message, account, paymentInformation and transcation level. Short explanation of the statuses (see supplementary documentation for further details) Confirm: validated -> toBeApproved | validated -> readyForDueDate (if approval is not used) Approve: toBeApproved -> readyForDueDate | toBeApproved -> toBeApproved (if more than 1 approval needed) Unapprove: readyForDueDate -> toBeApproved Cancel: * -> cancelled Prioritize: readyForDueDate -> readyForDueDate w/priority mark Unprioritize: readyForDueDate w/priority mark -> readyForDueDate Stop: readyForDueDate -> stopped Reactivate: stopped -> readyForDueDate Verify: validated -> verificationNeeded IgnoreLimit: stopped (due to payment over agreement limit) -> readyForDueDate
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 70=Technical error (Uncategorized) 6426=No payments found for status update (Validation) 6485=Not authorized for accounts (Validation) 6549=Required account identification (Account as input) 6600=Status update failed for all matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
Validation conditions (responseState.ErrorCode) 6601=Status update failed for some matching payments. Refer to ResultCode of individual StatusUpdateResults for detailed information
In case of 6600/6601, see errorCode, errrorMessage and severity for each payment. This corresponds to items normally found in the standard ResponseStateType, but since there is the possible for multiple payments for each status update operation, each error is specific to each payment transaction.
If no payments matches the requested criteria, an error will be thrown. If at least one payment fulfills the requested criteria, a validation error will be added for each failing payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import authority of signer certification sending the certificate is unknown for the second signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS24"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Waiting time expired due to incomplete order</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS25"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The order file was deleted by the bank server (for multiple reasons)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS26"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The same user has signed multiple times</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS27"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The user is not yet activated (technically)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid date (eg, wrong or missing settlement date)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid creation date and time in Group Header (eg, historic date)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid non bank processing date (eg, weekend or local public holiday)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Future date not supported</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Associated message, payment information block or transaction was received after agreed processing cut-off date, i.e., date in the past.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT06"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Execution Date has been modified in order for transaction to be processed</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DU01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Message Identification is not unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DU02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment Information Block is not unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DU03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction is not unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DU04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>End To End ID is not unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DU05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Instruction ID is not unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DUPL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment is a duplicate of another payment</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ED01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Correspondent bank not possible.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ED03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Balance of payments complementary info is requested</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ED05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Settlement of the transaction has failed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>File Format incomplete or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Syntax error reason is provided as narrative information in the additional reason information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment Type Information is missing or invalid. Generic usage if cannot specify Service Level or Local Instrument code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Service Level code is missing or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Local Instrument code is missing or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF06"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Category Purpose code is missing or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF07"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Purpose is missing or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF08"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>End to End Id missing or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF09"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Cheque number missing or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="FF10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>File or transaction cannot be processed due to technical issues at the bank side</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ID01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Signature file was sent to the bank but the corresponding original file has not been sent yet.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MD01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No Mandate</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MD02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mandate related information data required by the scheme is missing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MD05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor or creditor's agent should not have collected the direct debit</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MD06"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Return of funds requested by end customer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MD07"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>End customer is deceased.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MS02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reason has not been specified by end customer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MS03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reason has not been specified by agent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NARR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reason is provided as narrative information in the additional reason information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Bank identifier code specified in the message has an incorrect format (formerly IncorrectFormatForRoutingCode).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Bank identifier is invalid or missing. Generic usage if cannot specify between debit or credit account</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Debtor bank identifier is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor bank identifier is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BIC identifier is invalid or missing. Generic usage if cannot specify between debit or credit account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC06"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Debtor BIC identifier is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC07"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor BIC identifier is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC08"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ClearingSystemMemberidentifier is invalid or missing. Generic usage if cannot specify between debit or credit account</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC09"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Debtor ClearingSystemMember identifier is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor ClearingSystemMember identifier is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC11"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Intermediary Agent is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RC12"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor Scheme Id is invalid or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RF01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction reference is not unique within the message.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specification of the debtor's account or unique identification needed for reasons of regulatory requirements is insufficient or missing</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specification of the debtor's name and/or address needed for regulatory requirements is insufficient or missing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specification of the creditor's name and/or address needed for regulatory requirements is insufficient or missing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Regulatory Reason</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Regulatory or Central Bank Reporting information missing, incomplete or invalid.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR06"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Tax information missing, incomplete or invalid.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR07"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Remittance information structure does not comply with rules for payment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR08"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Remittance information truncated to comply with rules for payment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR09"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structured creditor reference invalid or missing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Character set supplied not valid for the country and payment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR11"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid or missing identification of a bank proprietary service.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="RR12"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid or missing identification required within a particular country or payment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SL01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Due to specific service offered by the Debtor Agent</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SL02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Due to specific service offered by the Creditor Agent</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TA01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The transmission of the file was not successful - it had to be aborted (for technical reasons)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TD01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>There is no data available (for download)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TD02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The file cannot be read (e.g. unknown format)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TD03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The file format is incomplete or invalid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TM01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Associated message, payment information block, or transaction was received after agreed processing cut-off time.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TS01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The (technical) transmission of the file was successful.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TS04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The order was transferred to pass by accompanying note signed by hand</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="SPOT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the market rate at the time of the sale.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v5" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v5" xmlns:st="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v4"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.edb.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v4"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="st:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="st:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="st:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="st:Max18Long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice.
